comment.author: 87842398@N00
comment._content: It's still standing.

comment.author: 33775116@N00
comment._content: Cool to see that photo, Darth Bengal!

comment.author: 87842398@N00
comment._content:
Thanks. 

This building has been transported to  Carillon Park in Dayton. The historical society that manages Carillon Park has preserved many  local treasures like the Newcom Tavern, that is pictured here. 

If you are in the area, Carillon Park is a great place to visit.

comment.author: 24191383@N04
comment._content: Photo taken after great Dayton flood of March, 1913.  Newcom Tavern originally stood at the corner of Main and Monument Streets, but was moved to the levee in the 1930's when it was rediscovered under its clapboard siding and "restored." In the late 1960's the roof was temporarily removed and it was trucked two miles south of downtown to Carillon Park and reassembled and where it remains.
